To see the islands that cannot be seen from the shore. The early Man was restricted in their observations by the curvature of the Earth, and hence our ancestors went and explored, to see with their own eyes what lies beyond the horizon, by going there. And so, back in a time that is recorded today only in the form of fossils, long before Columbus and the Vikings ventured to North America, Human kind went and populated nearly the entire globe. The ingenuity that was required to do so, along with the fact that no local natural disaster or even climate change could reach all of us, meant that we would not go instinct.This curiosity, and the ingenuity it drove us to develop, is a key factor in why we never became extinct, and why we are now the dominant species on our planet. That is why I believe that curiosity is such a defining trait of our Kind.
